net.krotscheck.dfr

Interface IDataDecoder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, IFilteringDataStream, Iterable<Map<String,Object>>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IStreamDecoder, ITextDecoder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataDecoder, AbstractStreamDecoder, AbstractTextDecoder, BSONDataDecoder, CSVDataDecoder, JSONDataDecoder

    public interface IDataDecoder
extends IFilteringDataStream, Iterable<Map<String,Object>>, Closeable
    This interface describes a data decoder, which attempts to convert a table-based file into an iterable key/value map.
    Author:
    Michael Krotscheck

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Long getMaxRows()
      Retrieve the number of rows which this decoder should stop at.
      String getMimeType()
      Retrieve the mimetype which this decoder supports.
      void setMaxRows(Long rows)
      Set the number of rows at which this decoder should stop.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.krotscheck.dfr.IFilteringDataStream

        addFilter, addFilters, applyFilters, clearFilters, containsFilter, getFilters, removeFilter

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • getMimeType

        String getMimeType()
        Retrieve the mimetype which this decoder supports.
        Returns:
        The mimetype, as a string.

      • getMaxRows

        Long getMaxRows()
        Retrieve the number of rows which this decoder should stop at.
        Returns:
        The number of rows, null for all rows.

      • setMaxRows

        void setMaxRows(Long rows)
        Set the number of rows at which this decoder should stop. Set to null to read all rows.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows, default null.
